q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
h:
“Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
h:
“Simplicity is the glory of expression.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Happiness is only real, when shared.
h:
“Happiness is only real, when shared.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
h:
“You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Live simply, expect little, give much.
h:
“Live simply, expect little, give much.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
h:
“Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: The greatest treasures are those invisible to the eye but found by the heart.
h:
“The greatest treasures are those invisible to the eye but found by the heart.” —
Judy Garland

q: Whatever you are, be a good one.
h:
“Whatever you are, be a good one.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: What the eye doesn't see and the mind doesn't know, doesn't exist.
h:
“What the eye doesn't see and the mind doesn't know, doesn't exist.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Do one thing every day that scares you.
h:
“Do one thing every day that scares you.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.
h:
“There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: A good master leads you to the true master within. Only that master, who is your own higher self, can adequately answer all questions.
h:
“A good master leads you to the true master within. Only that master, who is your own higher self, can adequately answer all questions.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.
h:
“I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
h:
“Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.” —
Aristotle

q: Your dream has to be bigger than your fear.
h:
“Your dream has to be bigger than your fear.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.
h:
“Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.
h:
“Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.” —
Bob Proctor

q: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
h:
“The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
h:
“Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy. ” —
George Washington

q: When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.
h:
“When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
h:
“Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.
h:
“People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.” —
Epictetus

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
h:
“The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
h:
“The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
h:
“Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
h:
“Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.
h:
“The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.” —
Dan Millman

q: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
h:
“The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
h:
“Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not common.
h:
“New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not common.” —
John Locke

q: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
h:
“Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The greater the impact you want to make, the greater your influence needs to be.
h:
“The greater the impact you want to make, the greater your influence needs to be.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
h:
“Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.” —
Mark Twain

q: It is in changing that we find purpose.
h:
“It is in changing that we find purpose.” —
Heraclitus

q: The divine is not something high above us. It is in heaven, it is in earth, it is inside us.
h:
“The divine is not something high above us. It is in heaven, it is in earth, it is inside us.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
h:
“He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.” —
Epictetus

q: Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.
h:
“Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
h:
“To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.” —
Criss Jami

q: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
h:
“A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
h:
“Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
h:
“Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
h:
“If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Help others and give something back.
h:
“Help others and give something back.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
h:
“Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
h:
“Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
h:
“To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.” —
Alexander Pope
